result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamitria Charmaine Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamitria Charmaine Johnson in court.  Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court for Lamitria Charmaine Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed with prejudice.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 8.26.2022

Defendant Lamitria Charmaine Johnson in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lamitria Charmaine Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. Case manager also present via Zoom. 
Defendant attended all office contacts. Defendant completed community service and letter of apology. Court COMMENDS the defendant.   Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing in Branch 21.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Review hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 5.23.2022
Letter of Apology  received and filed
Oral No VIOLENT Contact Order with A.S.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
 Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Lamitria Charmaine Johnson in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lamitria Charmaine Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
  Review hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Early Intervention Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed, Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed, Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
